appearances.snippet: and representative john garamendi says he's concerned the capture of maduro puts the u.s. on the brink of war, saying, quote, trump is now talking about governing venezuela. how can this be done without american boots on the ground and without bloodshed? meanwhile, the attack on venezuela has sparked celebrations and protests across the bay area and the country. many are left wondering what comes next for venezuela. abc seven news reporter tara campbell has reaction from activists and political experts. >> on venezuela. >> a call from the streets of san francisco for no war with venezuela. >> we reject his carrying out a war in our name. it's not with our permission. >> gloria la riva is the coordinator of the cuba venezuela solidarity committee. >> the hundreds of people here today on, i'd say five hours notice, is a powerful sign that the people of the us reject this. >> what do you think it means to have this kind of turnout here? >> i think it means a lot. within hours, people were organizing, and there will be coming back many, many times because we have to tell the p

appearances.title: ABC7 News 6:00AM : KGO : January 2, 2026 6:00am-7:00am PST
appearances.snippet: congressman john garamendi represents the area and is looking for an explanation. he's sending a letter to the federal government. >> mayor island had the low bid about $9 million. the high bid was vicar up in seattle. about $1 million more. 10 million plus. and the coast guard chose the high bid. and i'm going, what the hell is going on here? >> we asked the us coast guard for comment and have not heard back. >> there's a fight over control of a south bay museum in the new year could mean big changes. san jose's museum could change hands if dualing groups don't come to a deal. the museum and history park shut down more than a year ago because of the dispute. its collection includes artifacts from the vietnam war and refugees who resettled in northern california. the president of the nonprofit that oversees the museum says there were disagreements among previous museum employees and volunteers about who is in charge. they were given until december 31st to reach a resolution and did not. city council member ben dewan says his office is involved trying to mediate. >>

appearances.title: CBS News Bay Area: Morning Edition 6am : KPIX : January 2, 2026 6:00am-7:00am PST
appearances.snippet: congressman john garamendi, outraged, saying the coast guard gave the contract to service an icebreaker to a portland based company that's bid was over $1 million more than mare island's, a facility with a history of working on coast guard icebreakers, cutters and vessels. this is an industry that's been coming back the last couple of years, and then this occurs. the state's former director of the employment development department says mare islands closure is devastating for the 80 workers and their families, but thinks the working waterfront coalition is strong. these good, union based, well-paying, blue collar jobs, they're very difficult to replace. the solano county workforce development board is working with the impacted employees to find them jobs. the same group that's also searching for jobs for the 200 plus employees who will lose their jobs when the anheuser-busch budweiser facility closes in fairfield in february. and i hurt for them. and we're going to do everything we can to help. what does that mean? do we have money to give them? no. but do we have resources? we do. what

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 14, 2026 4:45pm-7:12pm EST
appearances.snippet: so i look forward to the discussion this evening, and i am now proud to introduce my colleague john garamendif california, a longtime advocate for arms control and with whom i've had the honor of spending the weekend underneath the north polar ice cap in a nuclear submarine. and i just it's my honor, and i will recognize him for the duration of his remarks. >> thank you, mr. foster. thank you for bringing us together to talk about this profoundly important situation. we stand here today on a precipice. in less than a month, the new start treaty, the last remaining major arms control agreement between the soviet union, russia and the united states, is set to expire. if we allow this treaty to lapse without a replacement, we will be entering a world we haven't seen in decades, a world without limits on the nuclear arsenals of the two largest nuclear powers, russia and the united states, will be stripping away the last guardrail, preventing a catastrophic return to an unchecked nuclear buildup. cold war. in 1985, president ronald reagan and soviet leader mikhail gorbachev declared a profound tru

appearances.title: U.S. House of Representatives U.S. House of Representatives : CSPAN : January 8, 2026 6:30pm-8:52pm EST
appearances.snippet: i now yield three minutes to my colleague from the great state of california, congressman john garamendi well, indeed, it is a great state because we have great freshmen representatives. thank you so very much for this special order, our and and the opportunity to really talk about a critical issue for our constituents in california and really all across america. if we go back to the beginning of the trump administration and we think about the various issues that he has put forth in the burdens that he's placed on america, one of the most important is in the big ugly bill. if you take a look at the big ugly bill and you get into the detail, well, there is the enhanced tax credits for the affordable care act, and we'll talk about that in a few moments. but also in the big ugly bill is the big problem coming up at the end of this 2026 year, they have put in place a dismantling of the medicaid program. they pushed it off until after the election. but the facts of the matter are those impacts are already being recognized across the health care system. it's going to affect every american, and

appearances.title: ABC7 News 11:00PM : KGO : January 3, 2026 11:00pm-12:00am PST
appearances.snippet: representative john garamendi is also concerned that the capture of maduro puts the u.s. on the brink of war, saying, quote, trump is now talking about governing venezuela. how can this be done without american boots on the ground and without bloodshed? make sure to stay with abc7 news for continuing coverage of the situation in venezuela. you can download the abc seven bay area news app for the latest, or go to our website, abc seven news.com. let's give you a live look outside right now. on this saturday night. we did get a little break from the rain this afternoon. you see how wet the roads there still are though. and that break is already coming to an end because another storm already getting set to roll in. so let's check in now with abc seven weather anchor spencer christian. when does it end? spencer. >> it doesn't seem to be ending at all, does it? frances no end to this, but no, it'll be ending in a few days. but for the meantime, we have more days of wet weather coming our way. starting again late tonight. looking at live doppler seven, you can see we have a few
